t: “Ho!*pn Every one who thirsts, come to the waters; And*ln you who have no money come, buy and eat. Come,*ln buy wine and milk Without*ln money and without cost.
Why*ln do you spend money for what is not bread, And*ln your wages for what does not satisfy? Listen*ln carefully to Me, and eat what is good, And*ln delight yourself in abundance.
Incline*ln your ear and come to Me. Listen,*ln that you may live; And*ln I will make an everlasting covenant with you, According*iln to*i the faithful mercies shown to David.
Behold,*ln I have made him a witness to the peoples, A*ln leader and commander for the peoples.
Behold,*ln you will call a nation you do not know, And*ln a nation which knows you not will run to you, Because*ln of the Lord*s your God, even the Holy One of Israel; For*ln He has glorified you.”
Seek*ln the Lord*s while He may be found; Call*ln upon Him while He is near.

Let*ln the wicked forsake his way And*ln the unrighteous man his thoughts; And*ln let him return to the Lord,*s And*ln He will have compassion on him, And*ln to our God, For*ln He will abundantly pardon.
“For*ln My thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor*ln are your ways My ways,” declares the Lord.*s
“For*ln as*i the heavens are higher than the earth, So*ln are My ways higher than your ways And*ln My thoughts than your thoughts.

For*ln as the rain and the snow come down from heaven, And*ln do not return there without watering the earth And*ln making it bear and sprout, And*ln furnishing seed to the sower and bread to the eater;
So*ln will My word be which goes forth from My mouth; It*ln will not return to Me empty, Without*ln accomplishing what I desire, And*ln without succeeding in*i the*i matter*i for which I sent it.

For*ln you will go out with joy And*ln be led forth with peace; The*ln mountains and the hills will break forth into shouts of joy before you, And*ln all the trees of the field will clap their*i hands.

Instead*ln of the thorn bush the cypress will come up, And*ln instead of the nettle the myrtle will come up, And*ln it will be a memorial to the Lord,*s For*ln an everlasting sign which will not be cut off.”
